result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonate A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as Probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence  or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

*NO violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
*NO contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
*Participate in sex offender treatment and programming as recommended by the agent.
*AODA assessment and programs or treatment as recommended.

timeConds.notes:
*Release for work and education.
*Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
*Court stayed this sentence until noon on 07/09/15.

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion of Justice Point report. Sentencing proceeds. Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by the State, defense counsel, and  the defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm or body armor; is to provide a DNA sample, cannot vote until his civil rights are restored, and comply with the sex offender reporting requirements.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE  8 years with  days credit 0 INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT 4  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION 4 years; pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. 

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.         

The Court stayed this sentence and placed the defendant on 4 years probation.



Conditions of extended supervision: 1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) no contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint; 3) participate in sex offender treatment and programming as recommended by the agent



Conditions of probation: 1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) no contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint; 3) participate in sex offender treatment and programming as recommended by the agent; 4) AODA assessment and programs or treatment as recommended; 5) pay any monetary amounts ordered ; 6) Court ordered the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Corrections with release for work and education. Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.  The Court stayed this sentence until noon on 07/09/2015. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

AMENDED ENTRY OF 60-10-15

Defendant IS NOT remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing./ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Deonate A Williams in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Court AMENDS the charge to Third Degree Sexual Assault 940.225(3) a Class G Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Deonate A Williams in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for adjournment for further negotiations with the State.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Epps is in jury trial and cannot appear.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Deonate A Williams not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Deonate A Williams in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information and waives reading.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties and charges.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court with Stephen Sargent for attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Deonate A Williams in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed. Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment to Branch 44.  Arraignment scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CCD

Defendant Deonate A Williams in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Deonate A Williams in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
